# ncurses

Ncurses Bindings for Crystal

## Installation


Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  ncurses:
    github: SamualLB/ncurses
```


## Usage


```crystal
require "ncurses"
```

#### Basic Printing

```crystal
NCurses.start

NCurses.print "Hello world!"

NCurses.end
```

#### Run Examples

Prints input
```text
$ crystal run examples/input.cr
```

Displays text with attributes
```text
$ crystal run examples/attributes.cr
```

Displays text with colors
```text
$ crystal run examples/colors.cr
```

Shows separate windows
```text
$ crystal run examples/windows.cr
```

Mouse interaction with individual windows
```text
$ crystal run examples/window_enclose.cr
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/SamualLB/ncurses.git )
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

instance_methods.name: non_relative
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a new `MouseEvent` with full-screen relative coordinates

The opposite of `#relative`

Wrapper for `wmouse_trafo()`
instance_methods.summary: Returns a new MouseEvent with full-screen relative coordinates

def.name: non_relative
def.body:
y = @coordinates[:y]
x = @coordinates[:x]
if LibNCurses.wmouse_trafo(window, pointerof(y), pointerof(x), true)
else
  raise("wmouse_trafo error")
end
m_e = MouseEvent.new(@device_id, {y: y, x: x, z: @coordinates[:z]}, @state)
if m_e.enclose?(window)
else
  raise("not inside")
end
m_e

if enclose?(window)
else
  raise("not inside")
end

x = @coordinates[:x]
if LibNCurses.wmouse_trafo(window, pointerof(y), pointerof(x), false)
else
  raise("wmouse_trafo error")
end
MouseEvent.new(@device_id, {y: y, x: x, z: @coordinates[:z]}, @state)

instance_methods.name: change_attribute
instance_methods.doc:
*attr* is the `Attribute` enum.
*color_pair* is the color pair number (0 is the default white on black.)
*length* defaults to -1, but represents the number of characters to change, up to EOL.
If *y* and *x* are set, the cursor location is moved before changing attributes.

Wrapper for `wchgat()` and `mvwchgat()` (`chgat()` and `mvchgat()`)
instance_methods.args_string: (attr : Attribute = Attribute::Normal, color_pair = 0, length = -1, y = nil, x = nil)

def.name: change_attribute
def.body:
if y.nil? || x.nil?
  LibNCurses.wchgat(self, length, attr, color_pair.to_i16, nil)
else
  LibNCurses.mvwchgat(self, y, x, length, attr, color_pair.to_i16, nil)
end
